content: I am unclear on what you are reporting. You state the PC crashed before the problem, yet also state that Thunderbird was updating during the crash. A crash may have destroyed the profile. Did you have to restore Windows after the crash? Did you restore Thunderbird? Have you logged onto the account online to see if the messages are there? Is the account IMAP or POP? Please share more information, and we will offer whatever assistance we can. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
1. The Message List Pane only displays emails within the folder itself, not emails in the subfolders.

2. I recommend using a saved search. The following link may be helpful: Using Saved Searches https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/using-saved-searches

Click the "Choose..." button, and then select the folders you want to include in the search.

Select "Match all messages" as your search criteria.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content: If this is a reference to the Mail Merge addon, I suggest you contact the developer.

content:
Hello

To see if.

You can try. Go to https://mail.google.com and connect. Then, Top right, Settings > See all settings. Click the Forwarding and POP/IMAP tab. Disable POP protocol. Then, at the bottom of the page, click on Save changes. Enable POP protocol. Then, at the bottom of the page, click on Save changes.

content:
To assist, it is important that we see what you're seeing. To do that, please post screenshots of - the error message - the 'account setting' pane of an account, the one showing 'outgoing server' on bottom line - the SMTP server settings pane for that account - the pane that lists all SMTP servers

Seeing that will help. Thank you.

content: I presume you are receiving an error message. Knowing its content may help. The error may be due to incorrect setup, and some email providers require separate passwords when using an email client and not the website. Please post more information on this. Thank you
creator: davidsk

content: If the intent is to copy to another thunderbird profile, I suggest copying, not exporting.
creator: davidsk

content: I presume you have thunderbird in another PC and want it in the new PC? There are two ways: - click tools>import>import from a file and follow the menus for addressbook to the option for file types. pick the 'sqlite' option and then locate and select the abook.sqlite file from old profile. then, repeat the process and select the history.sqlite file from old profile - the other option is to exit thunderbird and simply copy the abook.sqlite and history.sqlite files from the old profile and paste into the new profile. You can locate your new profile by clicking help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll to 'profile folder', click 'open folder' and then exit thunderbird. you will be in the profile.
creator: davidsk
